s.text: Such brief windows of rationality did not last long, but they gave mankind a much-needed break.
They usually serve to merely entrench a tyrant.
I think, in this sense, Jefferson would be pleased.
Poor communism was inefficient enough that its people were able to accomplish some things despite it, but efficient enough that they couldn't have cable TV.
Every self-respecting dictator will decorate himself with grand military titles--but let us set these baubles aside and concentrate on dictatorships run by genuine career military officers.
Every self-respecting dictator will decorate himself with grand military titles--but let us set these baubles aside and concentrate on dictatorships run by genuine career military officers.

Quibbling that evil leaders are to blame, not the institution of government itself, is a pathetic evasion, reminiscent of an NRA bumper sticker that reads, "Governments don't kill people, only criminal leaders kill people."

Quibbling that evil leaders are to blame, not the institution of government itself, is a pathetic evasion, reminiscent of an NRA bumper sticker that reads, "Governments don't kill people, only criminal leaders kill people."

Quibbling that evil leaders are to blame, not the institution of government itself, is a pathetic evasion, reminiscent of an NRA bumper sticker that reads, "Governments don't kill people, only criminal leaders kill people."
With it, each killed millions.

The Italian Renaissance flourished in small islands of such tolerance amid a patchwork quilt of fiefdoms run by local strongmen.
Dismal images of Russia unraveling after communism collapsed make an unintended point: At least there was something to unravel, unlike in so much of the rest of the world.

The reason societies with democratic governments are better places to live in than their alternatives isn't because of some goodness intrinsic to democracy, but because its hopeless inefficiency helps blunt the basic potential for evil.
Once the opposition is dead, and all but the most compliant are purged from the dictator's forces, what's there to worry about?
Once the opposition is dead, and all but the most compliant are purged from the dictator's forces, what's there to worry about?
Once the opposition is dead, and all but the most compliant are purged from the dictator's forces, what's there to worry about?
The examples of great evil done by governments are easy enough to rattle off.
Despotic governments are so efficient that they are easy to administer.
